   21: -module(process_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Tests processes, trapping exit messages and the BIFs:
   24: %% 	exit/1
   25: %%	exit/2
   26: %%	process_info/1,2
   27: %%	register/2 (partially)
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -define(heap_binary_size, 64).
   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   35: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, spawn_with_binaries/1,

   39: 	 exit_and_timeout/1, exit_twice/1,

   41:          process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race/1,
   42: 	 process_info_other_dist_msg/1,

   47:          process_info_garbage_collection/1,

  113: suite() ->
  114:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  115:      {timetrap, {minutes, 9}}].
  116: 
  117: all() ->
  118:     [spawn_with_binaries, t_exit_1, {group, t_exit_2},
  119:      trap_exit_badarg, trap_exit_badarg_in_bif,
  120:      bump_reductions, low_prio, yield, yield2, otp_4725,
  121:      dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak, bad_register, garbage_collect,
  122:      process_flag_badarg,
  123:      process_flag_fullsweep_after, process_flag_heap_size,
  124:      command_line_max_heap_size,
  125:      spawn_opt_heap_size, spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  126:      more_spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  127:      spawn_huge_arglist,
  128:      otp_6237,
  129:      {group, spawn_request},
  130:      {group, process_info_bif},
  131:      {group, processes_bif},
  132:      {group, otp_7738}, garb_other_running,

  138: groups() -> 
  139:     [{t_exit_2, [],
  140:       [t_exit_2_other, t_exit_2_other_normal, self_exit,
  141:        normal_suicide_exit, abnormal_suicide_exit,
  142:        t_exit_2_catch, exit_and_timeout, exit_twice]},
  143:      {spawn_request, [],
  144:       [spawn_request_bif,
  145:        spawn_request_monitor_demonitor,
  146:        spawn_request_monitor_child_exit,
  147:        spawn_request_link_child_exit,
  148:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit,
  149:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit_compound_reason,
  150:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit_nodedown,

  154:        spawn_against_old_node,

  156:        spawn_request_reply_option]},

  162:        processes_send_infant]},

  164:       [t_process_info, process_info_messages,
  165:        process_info_other, process_info_other_msg,
  166:        process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race,
  167:        process_info_other_dist_msg, process_info_other_status,
  168:        process_info_2_list,

  170:        process_info_lock_reschedule2,

  193: 
  194: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  195:     A0 = case application:start(sasl) of
  196: 	     ok -> [sasl];
  197: 	     _ -> []
  198: 	 end,
  199:     A = case application:start(os_mon) of
  200: 	     ok -> [os_mon|A0];
  201: 	     _ -> A0
  202: 	 end,
  203:     [{started_apps, A}|Config].
  204: 
  205: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  206:     As = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  207:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> application:stop(A) end, As),
  208:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  209:     Config.
  210: 
  211: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  212:     Config.
  213: 
  214: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  215:     Config.
  216: 
  217: init_per_testcase(Func, Config)
  218:   when Func =:= processes_default_tab;
  219:        Func =:= processes_this_tab ->
  220:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  221:         BT when BT =:= debug; BT =:= valgrind ->
  222:             {skip, "Don't run in debug/valgrind"};
  223:         _ ->
  224:             [{testcase, Func} | Config]
  225:     end;
  226: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  227:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
  228: 
  229: end_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  230:     %% Restore max_heap_size to default value.
  231:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size,
  232:                        #{size => 0,
  233:                          kill => true,
  234:                          include_shared_binaries => false,
  235:                          error_logger => true}),
  236:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  237: 
  238: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  239:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
  240: 
  241: %% Tests that binaries as arguments to spawn/3 doesn't leak
  242: %% (unclear if this test case will actually prove anything on
  243: %% a modern computer with lots of memory).
  244: spawn_with_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     L = lists:duplicate(2048, 42),
  246:     TwoMeg = lists:duplicate(1024, L),
  247:     Fun = fun() -> spawn(?MODULE, binary_owner, [list_to_binary(TwoMeg)]),
  248: 			 receive after 1 -> ok end end,
  249:     Iter = case test_server:is_valgrind() of
  250: 		     true -> 10;
  251: 		     false -> 150
  252: 		 end,
  253:     test_server:do_times(Iter, Fun),
  254:     ok.
  255: 
  256: binary_owner(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: %% Tests exit/1 with a big message.
  260: t_exit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  261:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  262:     start_spawner(),
  263:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  264:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_1/0),
  265:     stop_spawner(),
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: t_exit_1() ->
  269:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(kb_128()) end),
  270:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  271:     receive
  272: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  273: 	  end.
  274: 
  275: 
  276: %% Tests exit/2 with a lot of data in the exit message.
  277: t_exit_2_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  278:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  279:     start_spawner(),
  280:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  281:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_2_other/0),
  282:     stop_spawner(),
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: t_exit_2_other() ->
  286:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  287:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  288:     exit(Pid, Garbage),
  289:     receive
  290: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  291: 	  end.
  292: 
  293: %% Tests that exit(Pid, normal) does not kill another process.;
  294: t_exit_2_other_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  296:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  297:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  298:     exit(Pid, normal),
  299:     receive
  300: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  301: 		  ct:fail({process_died, Reason})
  302: 	  after 1000 ->
  303: 		  ok
  304: 	  end,
  305:     case process_info(Pid) of
  306: 	      undefined ->
  307: 		  ct:fail(process_died_on_normal);
  308: 	      List when is_list(List) ->
  309: 		  ok
  310: 	  end,
  311:     exit(Pid, kill),
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: %% Tests that we can trap an exit message sent with exit/2 from
  315: %% the same process.
  316: self_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  317:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  318:     start_spawner(),
  319:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  320:     test_server:do_times(200, fun self_exit/0),
  321:     stop_spawner(),
  322:     ok.
  323: 
  324: self_exit() ->
  325:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  326:     P = self(),
  327:     true = exit(P, Garbage),
  328:     receive
  329: 	      {'EXIT', P, Garbage} -> ok
  330: 	  end.
  331: 
  332: %% Tests exit(self(), normal) is equivalent to exit(normal) for a process
  333: %% that doesn't trap exits.
  334: normal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  335:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  336:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), normal) end),
  337:     receive
  338: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} -> ok;
  339: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  340: 	  end.
  341: 
  342: %% Tests exit(self(), Term) is equivalent to exit(Term) for a process
  343: %% that doesn't trap exits.";
  344: abnormal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  345:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  346:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  347:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), Garbage) end),
  348:     receive
  349: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok;
  350: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  351: 	  end.
  352: 
  353: %% Tests that exit(self(), die) cannot be caught.
  354: t_exit_2_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  355:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  356:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> catch exit(self(), die) end),
  357:     receive
  358: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  359: 		  ct:fail(catch_worked);
  360: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  361: 		  ok;
  362: 	      Other ->
  363: 		  ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  364: 	  end.
  365: 
  366: %% Tests trapping of an 'EXIT' message generated by a bad argument to
  367: %% the abs/1 bif.  The 'EXIT' message will intentionally be very big.
  368: trap_exit_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  369:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  370:     start_spawner(),
  371:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  372:     try
  373:         %% suppress  =ERROR REPORT=== emulator messages
  374:         ok = logger:add_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam, {
  375:             fun(#{meta := #{error_logger := #{emulator := true, tag := error}}}, _Report) ->
  376:                 stop;
  377:             (_Meta, _Report) ->
  378:                 ignore
  379:             end, ok}),
  380:         test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg/0),
  381:         ct:sleep(500) %% flush logging
  382:     after
  383:         ok = logger:remove_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam)
  384:     end,
  385:     stop_spawner(),
  386:     ok.
  387: 
  388: trap_exit_badarg() ->
  389:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> bad_guy(kb_128()) end),
  390:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  391:     receive
  392: 	      {'EXIT',Pid,{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[Garbage],Loc1},
  393: 				   {?MODULE,bad_guy,1,Loc2}|_]}}
  394: 	      when is_list(Loc1), is_list(Loc2) ->
  395: 		  ok;
  396: 	      Other ->
  397: 		  ok = io:format("Bad EXIT message: ~P", [Other, 30]),
  398: 		  ct:fail(bad_exit_message)
  399: 	  end.
  400: 
  401: bad_guy(Arg) ->
  402:     abs(Arg).
  403: 
  404: 
  405: kb_128() ->
  406:     Eight = eight_kb(),
  407:     {big_binary(),
  408:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  409:      big_binary(),
  410:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  411:      big_binary()}.
  412: 
  413: eight_kb() ->
  414:     B64 = lists:seq(1, 64),
  415:     B512 = {<<1>>,B64,<<2,3>>,B64,make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<4,5,6,7,8,9>>),
  416: 		  B64,make_sub_binary([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  417: 		  B64,make_sub_binary(lists:seq(1, ?heap_binary_size+1)),
  418: 		  B64,B64,B64,B64,big_binary()},
  419:     lists:duplicate(8, {B512,B512}).
  420: 
  421: big_binary() ->
  422:     big_binary(10, [42]).
  423: big_binary(0, Acc) ->
  424:     list_to_binary(Acc);
  425: big_binary(N, Acc) ->
  426:     big_binary(N-1, [Acc|Acc]).
  427: 
  428: %% Test receiving an EXIT message when spawning a BIF with bad arguments.
  429: trap_exit_badarg_in_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  430:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  431:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  432:     test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg_bif/0),
  433:     ok.
  434:     
  435: trap_exit_badarg_bif() ->
  436:     Pid = spawn_link(erlang, node, [1]),
  437:     receive
  438: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} ->
  439: 		  ok;
  440: 	      Other ->
  441: 		  ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  442: 	  end.
  443: 
  444: %% The following sequences of events have crasched Beam.
  445: %%
  446: %% 1) An exit is sent to a process which is currently not running.
  447: %%    The exit reason will (on purpose) overwrite the message queue
  448: %%    pointer.
  449: %% 2) Before the process is scheduled in, it receives a timeout (from
  450: %%    a 'receive after').
  451: %% 3) The process will crash the next time it executes 'receive'.
  452: 
  453: exit_and_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  454:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  455: 
  456:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  457:     Parent = self(),
  458:     Low = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_low(Parent) end),
  459:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_high(Low) end),
  460:     eat_wait_for(Low, High),
  461:     ok.
  462: 
  463: 
  464: eat_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  465:     receive
  466: 	{'EXIT', Low, {you, are, dead}} ->
  467: 	    ok;
  468: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  469: 	    eat_wait_for(Low, High);
  470: 	Other ->
  471: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  472:     end.
  473: 
  474: eat_low(_Parent) ->
  475:     receive
  476:     after 2500 ->
  477: 	    ok
  478:     end,
  479:     receive
  480: 	Any ->
  481: 	    io:format("Received: ~p\n", [Any])
  482:     after 1000 ->
  483: 	    ok
  484:     end.
  485:     
  486: eat_high(Low) ->
  487:     process_flag(priority, high),
  488:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  489:     exit(Low, {you, are, dead}),
  490:     loop(erlang:monotonic_time() + erlang:convert_time_unit(5,second,native)).
  491: 
  492: %% Busy loop for 5 seconds.
  493: 
  494: loop(StopTime) ->
  495:     case StopTime >= erlang:monotonic_time() of
  496: 	true -> ok;
  497: 	false -> loop(StopTime)
  498:     end.
  499: 
  500: 
  501: %% Tries to send two different exit messages to a process.
  502: %% (The second one should be ignored.)
  503: exit_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  505: 
  506:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  507:     Low = fun_spawn(fun etwice_low/0),
  508:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> etwice_high(Low) end),
  509:     etwice_wait_for(Low, High),
  510:     ok.
  511: 
  512: etwice_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  513:     receive
  514: 	{'EXIT', Low, first} ->
  515: 	    ok;
  516: 	{'EXIT', Low, Other} ->
  517: 	    ct:fail({wrong_exit_reason, Other});
  518: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  519: 	    etwice_wait_for(Low, High);
  520: 	Other ->
  521: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  522:     end.
  523: 
  524: etwice_low() ->
  525:     etwice_low().
  526: 
  527: etwice_high(Low) ->
  528:     process_flag(priority, high),
  529:     exit(Low, first),
  530:     exit(Low, second).
  531: 
  532: %% Tests the process_info/2 BIF.
  533: t_process_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     [] = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  535:     register(my_name, self()),
  536:     {registered_name, my_name} = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  537:     {status, running} = process_info(self(), status),
  538:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
  539:     {min_bin_vheap_size,46422} = process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
  540:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  541:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  542:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  543:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  544: 	process_info(self(), current_function),
  545:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  546: 	apply(erlang, process_info, [self(),current_function]),
  547: 
  548:     %% current_location and current_stacktrace
  549:     {Line1,Res1} = {?LINE,process_info(self(), current_location)},
  550:     verify_loc(Line1, Res1),
  551:     {Line2,Res2} = {?LINE,apply(erlang, process_info,
  552: 				[self(),current_location])},
  553:     verify_loc(Line2, Res2),
  554:     pi_stacktrace([{?MODULE,t_process_info,1,?LINE}]),
  555: 
  556:     verify_stacktrace_depth(),
  557: 
  558:     Gleader = group_leader(),
  559:     {group_leader, Gleader} = process_info(self(), group_leader),
  560:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_Info}} = (catch process_info('not_a_pid')),
  561:     ok.
  562: 
  563: verify_stacktrace_depth() ->
  564:     CS = current_stacktrace,
  565:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 0),
  566:     {CS,[]} = erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  567:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 8),
  568:     {CS,[{?MODULE,verify_stacktrace_depth,0,_},_|_]} =
  569:         erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  570:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth).
  571: 
  572: pi_stacktrace(Expected0) ->
  573:     {Line,Res} = {?LINE,erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace)},
  574:     {current_stacktrace,Stack} = Res,
  575:     Expected = [{?MODULE,pi_stacktrace,1,Line}|Expected0],
  576:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stack, Expected).
  577: 
  578: pi_stacktrace_1([{M,F,A,Loc}|Stk], [{M,F,A,Line}|Exp]) ->
  579:     case Loc of
  580: 	[] ->
  581: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  582: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  583: 		      [M,F,A]),
  584: 	    ok;
  585: 	[_|_] ->
  586: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  587: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  588: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  589:     end,
  590:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stk, Exp);
  591: pi_stacktrace_1([_|_], []) -> ok.
  592: 
  593: verify_loc(Line, {current_location,{?MODULE,t_process_info=F,1=A,Loc}}) ->
  594:     case Loc of
  595: 	[] ->
  596: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  597: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  598: 		      [?MODULE,F,A]),
  599: 	    ok;
  600: 	[_|_] ->
  601: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  602: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  603: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  604:     end.
  605: 
  606: process_info_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  607:     Self = self(),
  608:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> process_info_looper(Self) end),
  609:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  610:     pio_current_location(10000, Pid, 0, 0),
  611:     pio_current_stacktrace().
  612: 
  613: pio_current_location(0, _, Pi, Looper) ->
  614:     io:format("~w call(s) to erlang:process_info/2", [Pi]),
  615:     io:format("~w call(s) to ~w:process_info_looper/1", [Looper,?MODULE]);
  616: pio_current_location(N, Pid, Pi, Looper) ->
  617:     erlang:yield(),
  618:     {current_location,Where} = process_info(Pid, current_location),
  619:     case Where of
  620: 	{erlang,process_info,2,[]} ->
  621: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  622: 	{erts_internal,await_result,1, Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  623: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  624: 	{?MODULE,process_info_looper,1,Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  625: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi, Looper+1);
  626: 	_ ->
  627: 	    exit({unexpected_location, Where})
  628:     end.
  629: 
  630: pio_current_stacktrace() ->
  631:     L = [begin
  632: 	     case process_info(P, current_stacktrace) of
  633:                  {current_stacktrace, Stk} -> {P,Stk};
  634:                  undefined -> {P, []}
  635:              end
  636: 	 end || P <- processes()],
  637:     [erlang:garbage_collect(P) || {P,_} <- L],
  638:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  639:     [verify_stacktrace(Stk) || {_,Stk} <- L],
  640:     ok.
  641: 
  642: verify_stacktrace([{M,F,A,Loc}|T])
  643:   when is_atom(M),
  644:        is_atom(F),
  645:        is_integer(A),
  646:        is_list(Loc) ->
  647:     verify_stacktrace(T);
  648: verify_stacktrace([]) -> ok.
  649: 
  650: process_info_looper(Parent) ->
  651:     process_info(Parent, current_location),
  652:     process_info_looper(Parent).
  653: 
  654: %% Tests the process_info/1 BIF on another process with messages.
  655: process_info_other_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  656:     Self = self(),
  657:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  658:     receive
  659: 	{go_ahead,Pid} -> ok
  660:     end,
  661: 
  662:     Own = {my,own,message},
  663: 
  664:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  665:     
  666:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  667:     MsgA = {a,Garbage},
  668:     MsgB = {b,Garbage},
  669:     MsgC = {c,Garbage},
  670:     MsgD = {d,Garbage},
  671:     MsgE = {e,Garbage},
  672: 
  673:     Pid ! MsgA,
  674:     {messages,[Own,MsgA]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  675:     Pid ! MsgB,
  676:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  677:     Pid ! MsgC,
  678:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  679:     Pid ! MsgD,
  680:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  681:     Pid ! MsgE,
  682:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  683:     {memory,BytesOther} = process_info(Pid, memory),
  684:     {memory,BytesSelf} = process_info(self(), memory),
  685: 
  686:     io:format("Memory ~p: ~p\n", [Pid,BytesOther]),
  687:     io:format("Memory ~p (self): ~p\n", [self(),BytesSelf]),
  688: 
  689:     [Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE] = All,
  690: 
  691:     Pid ! {self(),empty},
  692:     receive
  693: 	      empty -> ok
  694: 	  end,
  695:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  696: 
  697:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
  698:     {min_bin_vheap_size, 46422} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
  699:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  700:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  701:         process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
  702: 
  703:     Pid ! stop,
  704:     ok.
  705: 
  706: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  707:     %% OTP-18169
  708:     %%
  709:     %% The race window triggering this bug is quite small. This test
  710:     %% wont fail even with the bug present, but it may trigger an
  711:     %% assertion in the debug compiled emulator if the bug is
  712:     %% present...
  713:     process_flag(priority, high),
  714:     SSchdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  715:                   1 -> 1;
  716:                   _ -> 2
  717:               end,
  718:     Flush = fun Flush () ->
  719:                     receive _ -> Flush()
  720:                     after 0 -> ok
  721:                     end
  722:             end,
  723:     RFun = fun RFun () ->
  724:                    receive
  725:                        {flush, From} ->
  726:                            Flush(),
  727:                            From ! flushed
  728:                    end,
  729:                    RFun()
  730:            end,
  731:     R = spawn_opt(RFun, [link,
  732:                          {scheduler, 1},
  733:                          {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  734:     SFun = fun SFun () ->
  735:                    receive go -> ok end,
  736:                    M = erlang:monitor(process, R),
  737:                    R ! hi,
  738:                    receive
  739:                        {demonitor, From} ->
  740:                            _ = erlang:demonitor(M),
  741:                            From ! demonitored
  742:                    end,
  743:                    SFun()
  744:            end,
  745:     S = spawn_opt(SFun, [link,
  746:                          {scheduler, SSchdlr},
  747:                          {priority, high}]),
  748:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(10000, S, R),
  749:     unlink(R),
  750:     exit(R, kill),
  751:     unlink(S),
  752:     exit(S, kill),
  753:     false = is_process_alive(R),
  754:     false = is_process_alive(S),
  755:     ok.
  756: 
  757: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(0, _S, _R) ->
  758:     ok;
  759: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N, S, R) ->
  760:     S ! go,
  761:     erlang:yield(),
  762:     _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
  763:     S ! {demonitor, self()},
  764:     receive demonitored -> ok end,
  765:     R ! {flush, self()},
  766:     receive flushed -> ok end,
  767:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N-1, S, R).
  768: 
  769: process_info_other_dist_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  770:     %%
  771:     %% Check that process_info can handle messages that have not been
  772:     %% decoded yet.
  773:     %%
  774:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  775:     Self = self(),
  776:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  777:     receive {go_ahead,Pid} -> ok end,
  778: 
  779:     Own = {my,own,message},
  780: 
  781:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  782:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  783:     MsgA = {a,self(),Garbage},
  784:     MsgB = {b,self(),Garbage},
  785:     MsgC = {c,self(),Garbage},
  786:     MsgD = {d,self(),Garbage},
  787:     MsgE = {e,self(),Garbage},
  788: 
  789:     %% We don't want the other process to decode messages itself
  790:     %% therefore we suspend it.
  791:     true =  erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
  792:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  793: 		Pid  ! MsgA,
  794: 		Pid  ! MsgB,
  795: 		Pid  ! MsgC,
  796: 		Self ! check_abc
  797: 	end),
  798:     receive check_abc -> ok end,
  799:     [{status,suspended},
  800: 	{messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]},
  801: 	{status,suspended}]= process_info(Pid, [status,messages,status]),
  802:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  803: 		Pid  ! MsgD,
  804: 		Pid  ! MsgE,
  805: 		Self ! check_de
  806: 	end),
  807:     receive check_de -> ok end,
  808:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  809:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
  810:     Pid ! {self(), get_all_messages},
  811:     receive
  812: 	      {all_messages, AllMsgs} ->
  813: 		  All = AllMsgs
  814: 	  end,
  815:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  816:     Pid ! stop,
  817:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  818:     ok.
  819: 
  820: process_info_other_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  821:     %% OTP-17628: status was erroneously reported as 'running',
  822:     %% when it should be 'waiting', when the priority of the
  823:     %% caller exceeded the priority of the processes being
  824:     %% checked (due to prio elevation).
  825:     Self = self(),
  826:     Other = spawn_link(fun () -> other_process(Self) end),
  827:     receive {go_ahead, Other} -> ok end,
  828:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  829:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  830:     process_flag(priority, high),
  831:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  832:     process_flag(priority, max),
  833:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  834:     Other ! stop,
  835:     ok.
  836: 
  837: other_process(Parent) ->
  838:     self() ! {my,own,message},
  839:     Parent ! {go_ahead,self()},
  840:     other_process_1().
  841: 
  842: other_process_1() ->
  843:     receive
  844: 	{Parent,get_all_messages} ->
  845: 	    Parent ! {all_messages, get_all_messages()},
  846: 	    other_process_1();
  847: 	{Parent,empty} ->
  848: 	    receive_all(),
  849: 	    Parent ! empty,
  850: 	    other_process_1();
  851: 	stop -> ok
  852:     end.
  853: 
  854: get_all_messages() ->
  855:     get_all_messages([]).
  856: 
  857: get_all_messages(Msgs) ->
  858:     receive
  859: 	Msg ->
  860: 	    get_all_messages([Msg|Msgs])
  861:     after 0 ->
  862: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  863:     end.
  864: 
  865: receive_all() ->
  866:     receive
  867: 	_ -> receive_all()
  868:     after 0 -> ok
  869:     end.
  870: 
  871: chk_pi_order([],[]) ->
  872:     ok;
  873: chk_pi_order([{Arg, _}| Values], [Arg|Args]) ->
  874:     chk_pi_order(Values, Args).
  875: 
  876: process_info_2_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  877:     Proc = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  878:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list1, self()),
  879:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list2, Proc),
  880:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state,true),
  881:     AllArgs = erts_debug:get_internal_state(process_info_args),
  882:     A1 = lists:sort(AllArgs) ++ [status] ++ lists:reverse(AllArgs),
  883: 
  884:     %% Verify that argument is accepted as single atom
  885:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
  886: 		{A, _} = process_info(Proc, A),
  887: 		{A, _} = process_info(self(), A)
  888: 	end, A1),
  889: 
  890:     %% Verify that order is preserved
  891:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(self(), A1), A1),
  892:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(Proc, A1), A1),
  893: 
  894:     %% Small arg list
  895:     A2 = [status, stack_size, trap_exit, priority],
  896:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  897: 	= process_info(Proc, A2),
  898:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  899: 	= process_info(self(), A2),
  900: 
  901:     %% Huge arg list (note values are shared)
  902:     A3 = lists:duplicate(5000,backtrace),
  903:     V3 = process_info(Proc, A3),
  904:     5000 = length(V3),
  905:     lists:foreach(fun ({backtrace, _}) -> ok end, V3),
  906:     ok.
  907:     
  908: process_info_lock_reschedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  909:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
  910:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
  911:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
  912:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
  913:     register(Name1, Target1),
  914:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  915:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
  916:     register(Name2, Target2),
  917:     PI = fun(_) ->
  918: 	    erlang:yield(),
  919: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}] = process_info(Target1, [registered_name]),
  920: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}] = process_info(Target2, [registered_name]),
  921: 	    erlang:yield(),
  922: 	    {registered_name, Name1} = process_info(Target1, registered_name),
  923: 	    {registered_name, Name2} = process_info(Target2, registered_name),
  924: 	    erlang:yield(),
  925: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}| _] = process_info(Target1),
  926: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}| _] = process_info(Target2)
  927:     end,
  928:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000)),
  929:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
  930:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
  931: 	{status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
  932: 				OkStatus == running;
  933: 				OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
  934: 	    unlink(Target1),
  935: 	    unlink(Target2),
  936: 	    exit(Target1, bang),
  937: 	    exit(Target2, bang),
  938: 	    OkStatus;
  939: 	{status, BadStatus} ->
  940: 	    ct:fail(BadStatus)
  941:     end.
  942: 
  943: pi_loop(_Name, _Pid, 0) ->
  944:     ok;
  945: pi_loop(Name, Pid, N) ->
  946:     {registered_name, Name} = process_info(Pid, registered_name),
  947:     pi_loop(Name, Pid, N-1).
  948: 
  949: process_info_lock_reschedule2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  950:     Parent = self(),
  951:     Fun = fun () ->
  952: 	    receive {go, Name, Pid} -> ok end,
  953: 	    pi_loop(Name, Pid, 10000),
  954: 	    Parent ! {done, self()},
  955: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  956:     end,
  957:     P1 = spawn_link(Fun),
  958:     N1 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_1,
  959:     true = register(N1, P1),
  960:     P2 = spawn_link(Fun),
  961:     N2 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_2,
  962:     true = register(N2, P2),
  963:     P3 = spawn_link(Fun),
  964:     N3 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_3,
  965:     true = register(N3, P3),
  966:     P4 = spawn_link(Fun),
  967:     N4 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_4,
  968:     true = register(N4, P4),
  969:     P5 = spawn_link(Fun),
  970:     N5 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_5,
  971:     true = register(N5, P5),
  972:     P6 = spawn_link(Fun),
  973:     N6 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_6,
  974:     true = register(N6, P6),
  975:     P1 ! {go, N2, P2},
  976:     P2 ! {go, N1, P1},
  977:     P3 ! {go, N1, P1},
  978:     P4 ! {go, N1, P1},
  979:     P5 ! {go, N6, P6},
  980:     P6 ! {go, N5, P5},
  981:     receive {done, P1} -> ok end,
  982:     receive {done, P2} -> ok end,
  983:     receive {done, P3} -> ok end,
  984:     receive {done, P4} -> ok end,
  985:     receive {done, P5} -> ok end,
  986:     receive {done, P6} -> ok end,
  987:     unlink(P1), exit(P1, bang),
  988:     unlink(P2), exit(P2, bang),
  989:     unlink(P3), exit(P3, bang),
  990:     unlink(P4), exit(P4, bang),
  991:     unlink(P5), exit(P5, bang),
  992:     unlink(P6), exit(P6, bang),
  993:     ok.
  994: 
  995: many_args(0,_B,_C,_D,_E,_F,_G,_H,_I,_J) ->
  996:     ok;
  997: many_args(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J) ->
  998:     many_args(A-1,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J).
  999: 
 1000: do_pi_msg_len(PT, AT) ->
 1001:     lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, [a,b,c,d]),
 1002:     {message_queue_len, _} = process_info(element(2,PT), element(2,AT)).
 1003:     
 1004: process_info_lock_reschedule3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1005:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
 1006:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
 1007:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
 1008:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
 1009:     register(Name1, Target1),
 1010:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1011:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
 1012:     register(Name2, Target2),
 1013:     PI = fun(N) ->
 1014: 	    case N rem 10 of
 1015: 		0 -> erlang:yield();
 1016: 		_ -> ok
 1017: 	    end,
 1018: 	    do_pi_msg_len({proc, Target1},
 1019: 		{arg, message_queue_len})
 1020:     end,
 1021:     many_args(100000,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
 1022:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000000)),
 1023:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
 1024:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
 1025: 	      {status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
 1026: 				      OkStatus == running;
 1027: 				      OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
 1028: 		  unlink(Target1),
 1029: 		  unlink(Target2),
 1030: 		  exit(Target1, bang),
 1031: 		  exit(Target2, bang),
 1032: 		  OkStatus;
 1033: 	      {status, BadStatus} ->
 1034: 		  ct:fail(BadStatus)
 1035: 	  end.
 1036: 
 1037: otp_4725(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1038:     Tester = self(),
 1039:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
 1040:     Pid1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1041: 		Tester ! {Ref1, process_info(self())},
 1042: 		receive
 1043: 		    Ref1 -> bye
 1044: 		end
 1045: 	end, [link, {priority, max}, {fullsweep_after, 600}]),
 1046:     receive
 1047: 	{Ref1, ProcInfo1A} ->
 1048: 	    ProcInfo1B = process_info(Pid1),
 1049: 	    Pid1 ! Ref1,
 1050: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo1A, ProcInfo1B)
 1051:     end,
 1052:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
 1053:     Pid2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1054: 		Tester ! {Ref2, process_info(self())},
 1055: 		receive
 1056: 		    Ref2 -> bye
 1057: 		end
 1058: 	end,
 1059: 	[]),
 1060:     receive
 1061: 	{Ref2, ProcInfo2A} ->
 1062: 	    ProcInfo2B = process_info(Pid2),
 1063: 	    Pid2 ! Ref2,
 1064: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo2A, ProcInfo2B)
 1065:     end,
 1066:     ok.
 1067: 
 1068: check_proc_infos(A, B) ->
 1069:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, A),
 1070:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, B),
 1071: 
 1072:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
 1073:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, B),
 1074: 
 1075:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, A),
 1076:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, B),
 1077: 
 1078:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, A),
 1079:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, B),
 1080: 
 1081:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, A),
 1082:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, B),
 1083: 
 1084:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, A),
 1085:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, B),
 1086: 
 1087:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, A),
 1088:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, B),
 1089: 
 1090:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, A),
 1091:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, B),
 1092:     {value, {garbage_collection, GClist}} = GC,
 1093: 
 1094:     %% This is not really documented
 1095:     true = is_integer(gv(minor_gcs, GClist)),
 1096:     true = is_integer(gv(fullsweep_after, GClist)),
 1097:     true = is_integer(gv(min_heap_size, GClist)),
 1098:     #{error_logger := Bool1,
 1099:       include_shared_binaries := Bool2,
 1100:       kill := Bool3,
 1101:       size := MaxHeapSize} = gv(max_heap_size, GClist),
 1102:     true = is_boolean(Bool1),
 1103:     true = is_boolean(Bool2),
 1104:     true = is_boolean(Bool3),
 1105:     true = is_integer(MaxHeapSize),
 1106: 
 1107:     ok.
 1108:
