 1112: start_spawner() ->
 1113:     ok.
 1114: 
 1115: stop_spawner() ->
 1116:     ok.
 1117: 
 1118: %% Tests erlang:process_info(Pid, garbage_collection_info)
 1119: process_info_garbage_collection(_Config) ->
 1120:     Parent = self(),
 1121:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1122:             fun() ->
 1123:                     %% We set mqd to off_heap and send an tuple
 1124:                     %% to process in order to force mbuf_size
 1125:                     %% to be used
 1126:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1127:                     receive go -> ok end,
 1128:                     (fun F(0) ->
 1129:                              Parent ! deep,
 1130:                              receive {ok,_} -> ok end,
 1131:                              [];
 1132:                          F(N) ->
 1133:                              timer:sleep(1),
 1134:                              [lists:seq(1,100) | F(N-1)]
 1135:                      end)(1000),
 1136:                     Parent ! shallow,
 1137:                     receive done -> ok end
 1138:             end),
 1139:     [{garbage_collection_info, Before},{total_heap_size, THSBefore}] =
 1140:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1141:     Pid ! go, receive deep -> ok end,
 1142:     [{_, Deep},{_,THSDeep}]  =
 1143:          erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1144:     Pid ! {ok, make_ref()}, receive shallow -> ok end,
 1145:     [{_, After},{_, THSAfter}] =
 1146:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1147:     Pid ! done,
 1148: 
 1149:     %% Do some general checks to see if everything seems to be roughly correct
 1150:     ct:log("Before: ~p",[Before]),
 1151:     ct:log("Deep: ~p",[Deep]),
 1152:     ct:log("After: ~p",[After]),
 1153:     ct:log("Before THS: ~p",[THSBefore]),
 1154:     ct:log("Deep THS: ~p",[THSDeep]),
 1155:     ct:log("After THS: ~p",[THSAfter]),
 1156: 
 1157:     %% Check stack_size
 1158:     true = gv(stack_size, Before) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1159:     true = gv(stack_size, After) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1160: 
 1161:     %% Check used heap size
 1162:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1163:         < gv(heap_size, Deep) + gv(old_heap_size, Deep),
 1164:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1165:         < gv(heap_size, After) + gv(old_heap_size, After),
 1166: 
 1167:     %% Check that total_heap_size == heap_block_size + old_heap_block_size + mbuf_size
 1168:     THSBefore = gv(heap_block_size, Before)
 1169:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Before)
 1170:         + gv(mbuf_size, Before),
 1171: 
 1172:     THSDeep = gv(heap_block_size, Deep)
 1173:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Deep)
 1174:         + gv(mbuf_size, Deep),
 1175: 
 1176:     THSAfter = gv(heap_block_size, After)
 1177:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, After)
 1178:         + gv(mbuf_size, After),
 1179: 
 1180:     ok.
 1181: 
 1182: gv(Key,List) ->
 1183:     proplists:get_value(Key,List).
 1184: 
 1185: process_info_parent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1186:     Child = spawn_link(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end),
 1187:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()}, erlang:process_info(Child, parent)),
 1188:     Child ! stop,
 1189:     ?assertEqual({parent, undefined}, erlang:process_info(whereis(init), parent)),
 1190: 
 1191:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1192:     RemoteChild = spawn_link(Node,
 1193:                              fun () ->
 1194:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1195:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1196:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1197:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1198:                                      Parent ! remote_child_hello,
 1199:                                      receive stop -> ok end
 1200:                              end),
 1201:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()},
 1202:                  erpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [RemoteChild, parent])),
 1203:     receive remote_child_hello -> ok end,
 1204:     unlink(RemoteChild),
 1205:     RemoteChild ! stop,
 1206:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1207:     ok.
 1208: 
 1209: process_info_smoke_all_tester() ->
 1210:     register(process_info_smoke_all_tester, self()),
 1211:     put(ets_ref, ets:new(blupp, [])),
 1212:     put(binary, [list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 1)),
 1213:                  list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 2))]),
 1214:     process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop().
 1215: 
 1216: process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop() ->
 1217:     receive
 1218:         {other_process, Pid} ->
 1219:             case get(procs) of
 1220:                 undefined -> put(procs, [Pid]);
 1221:                 Procs -> put(procs, [Pid|Procs])
 1222:             end,
 1223:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1224:             link(Pid),
 1225:             process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop()
 1226:     end.
 1227: 
 1228: process_info_smoke_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1229:     AllPIOptions = [registered_name,
 1230:                     current_function,
 1231:                     initial_call,
 1232:                     messages,
 1233:                     message_queue_len,
 1234:                     links,
 1235:                     monitors,
 1236:                     monitored_by,
 1237:                     dictionary,
 1238:                     trap_exit,
 1239:                     error_handler,
 1240:                     heap_size,
 1241:                     stack_size,
 1242:                     memory,
 1243:                     garbage_collection,
 1244:                     group_leader,
 1245:                     reductions,
 1246:                     priority,
 1247:                     trace,
 1248:                     binary,
 1249:                     sequential_trace_token,
 1250:                     catchlevel,
 1251:                     backtrace,
 1252:                     last_calls,
 1253:                     total_heap_size,
 1254:                     suspending,
 1255:                     min_heap_size,
 1256:                     min_bin_vheap_size,
 1257:                     max_heap_size,
 1258:                     current_location,
 1259:                     current_stacktrace,
 1260:                     message_queue_data,
 1261:                     garbage_collection_info,
 1262:                     magic_ref,
 1263:                     fullsweep_after],
 1264: 
 1265:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1266:     RP = spawn_link(Node, fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1267:     LP = spawn_link(fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1268:     RP ! {other_process, LP},
 1269:     LP ! {other_process, RP},
 1270:     LP ! {other_process, self()},
 1271:     LP ! ets:new(blapp, []),
 1272:     LP ! ets:new(blipp, []),
 1273:     LP ! list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 3)),
 1274:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1275:     _MLP = erlang:monitor(process, LP),
 1276:     true = is_process_alive(LP),
 1277:     PI = process_info(LP, AllPIOptions),
 1278:     io:format("~p~n", [PI]),
 1279:     garbage_collect(),
 1280:     unlink(RP),
 1281:     unlink(LP),
 1282:     exit(RP, kill),
 1283:     exit(LP, kill),
 1284:     false = is_process_alive(LP),
 1285:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1286:     ok.
 1287: 
 1288: process_info_status_handled_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1289:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1290:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1291:                    end),
 1292:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1293:                        process_info(P, status) == {status, waiting}
 1294:                end),
 1295:     %%
 1296:     %% The 'messages' option will force a process-info-request
 1297:     %% signal to be scheduled on the process. Ensure that status
 1298:     %% 'waiting' is reported even though it is actually running
 1299:     %% when handling the request. We want it to report the status
 1300:     %% it would have had if it had not been handling the
 1301:     %% process-info-request...
 1302:     %%
 1303:     [{status, waiting}, {messages, []}] = process_info(P, [status, messages]),
 1304:     unlink(P),
 1305:     exit(P, kill),
 1306:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1307:     ok.
 1308: 
 1309: %% OTP-15709
 1310: %% Provoke a bug where process_info(reductions) returned wrong result
 1311: %% because REDS_IN (def_arg_reg[5]) is read when the process in not running.
 1312: %%
 1313: %% And a bug where process_info(reductions) on a process which was releasing its
 1314: %% main lock during execution could result in negative reduction diffs.
 1315: process_info_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1316:     {S1, S2} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1317:                    1 -> {1,1};
 1318:                    _ -> {1,2}
 1319:                end,
 1320:     io:format("Run on schedulers ~p and ~p\n", [S1,S2]),
 1321:     Boss = self(),
 1322:     Doer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1323:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_spinnloop/0, S2),
 1324:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_recvloop/0, S2),
 1325:                              pi_reductions_tester(false, 100, fun pi_reductions_main_unlocker/0, S2),
 1326:                              Boss ! {self(), done}
 1327:                      end,
 1328:                      [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
 1329: 
 1330:     {Doer, done} = receive M -> M end,
 1331:     ok.
 1332: 
 1333: pi_reductions_tester(ForceSignal, MaxCalls, Fun, S2) ->
 1334:     Pid = spawn_opt(Fun, [link, {scheduler,S2}]),
 1335:     Extra = case ForceSignal of
 1336:                 true ->
 1337:                     %% Add another item that force sending the request
 1338:                     %% as a signal, like 'current_function'.
 1339:                     [current_function];
 1340:                 false ->
 1341:                     []
 1342:             end,
 1343:     LoopFun = fun Me(Calls, Prev, Acc0) ->
 1344:                       PI = process_info(Pid, [reductions | Extra]),
 1345:                       [{reductions,Reds} | _] = PI,
 1346:                       Diff = Reds - Prev,
 1347:                       %% Verify we get sane non-negative reduction diffs
 1348:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 0)},
 1349:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff =< 1000*1000)},
 1350:                       Acc1 = [Diff | Acc0],
 1351:                       case Calls >= MaxCalls of
 1352:                           true -> Acc1;
 1353:                           false -> Me(Calls+1, Reds, Acc1)
 1354:                       end
 1355:               end,
 1356:     DiffList = LoopFun(0, 0, []),
 1357:     unlink(Pid),
 1358:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1359:     io:format("Reduction diffs: ~p\n", [lists:reverse(DiffList)]),
 1360:     ok.
 1361: 
 1362: pi_reductions_spinnloop() ->
 1363:     %% 6 args to make use of def_arg_reg[5] which is also used as REDS_IN
 1364:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(999*1000, atom, "hej", self(), make_ref(), 3.14).
 1365: 
 1366: pi_reductions_spinnloop(N,A,B,C,D,E) when N > 0 ->
 1367:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(N-1,B,C,D,E,A);
 1368: pi_reductions_spinnloop(0,_,_,_,_,_) ->
 1369:     %% Stop to limit max number of reductions consumed
 1370:     pi_reductions_recvloop().
 1371: 
 1372: pi_reductions_recvloop() ->
 1373:     receive
 1374:         "a free lunch" -> false
 1375:     end.
 1376: 
 1377: pi_reductions_main_unlocker() ->
 1378:     Other = spawn_link(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1379:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1380: 
 1381: pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other) ->
 1382:     %% Assumption: register(OtherPid, Name) will unlock main lock of calling
 1383:     %% process during execution.
 1384:     register(pi_reductions_main_unlocker, Other),
 1385:     unregister(pi_reductions_main_unlocker),
 1386: 
 1387:     %% Yield in order to increase probability of process_info sometimes probing
 1388:     %% this process when it's not RUNNING.
 1389:     erlang:yield(),
 1390:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1391: 
 1392: process_info_self_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1393:     %% Test that signals that we have sent to ourselves are
 1394:     %% visible in process_info() result. This is not strictly
 1395:     %% a necessary property, but implemented so now. See
 1396:     %% process_info.c:process_info_bif() for more info.
 1397:     Self = self(),
 1398:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1399:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1400:                              process_info_self_signal_spammer(Self)
 1401:                      end,
 1402:                      fun () ->
 1403:                              self() ! Ref,
 1404:                              process_info(self(), messages)
 1405:                      end,
 1406:                      fun (Res) ->
 1407:                              {messages, [Ref]} = Res
 1408:                      end).
 1409: 
 1410: process_info_self_signal_spammer(To) ->
 1411:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1412:     process_info_self_signal_spammer(To).
 1413: 
 1414: process_info_self_msgq_len(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1415:     %% Spam ourselves with signals forcing us to flush own
 1416:     %% signal queue..
 1417:     Self = self(),
 1418:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1419:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1420:                      end,
 1421:                      fun () ->
 1422:                              process_info(self(), message_queue_len)
 1423:                      end,
 1424:                      fun (Res) ->
 1425:                              {message_queue_len, Len} = Res,
 1426:                              true = Len > 0,
 1427:                              ok
 1428:                      end).
 1429: 
 1430: 
 1431: process_info_self_msgq_len_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1432:     %% Spam ourselves with signals normally forcing us to flush own
 1433:     %% signal queue, but since we also want messages wont be flushed...
 1434:     Self = self(),
 1435:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1436:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self, 100000)
 1437:                      end,
 1438:                      fun () ->
 1439:                              process_info(self(),
 1440:                                           [message_queue_len,
 1441:                                            messages])
 1442:                      end,
 1443:                      fun (Res) ->
 1444:                              [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1445:                               {messages, Msgs}] = Res,
 1446:                              Len = length(Msgs),
 1447:                              ok
 1448:                      end).
 1449: 
 1450: process_info_self_msgq_len_more(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1451:     self() ! hej,
 1452:     BodyRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body(),
 1453:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(BodyRes),
 1454:     TailRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail(),
 1455:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(TailRes),
 1456:     receive hej -> ok end,
 1457:     %% Check that current_function, current_location, and
 1458:     %% current_stacktrace give sane results flushing or not...
 1459:     Self = self(),
 1460:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1461:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1462:                      end,
 1463:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body/0,
 1464:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result/1),
 1465:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1466:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1467:                      end,
 1468:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail/0,
 1469:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result/1).
 1470: 
 1471: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body() ->
 1472:     Res = process_info(self(),
 1473:                        [message_queue_len,
 1474:                         current_function,
 1475:                         current_location,
 1476:                         current_stacktrace]),
 1477:     id(Res).
 1478: 
 1479: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(Res) ->
 1480:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1481:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0}},
 1482:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_}},
 1483:      {current_stacktrace,
 1484:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1485:     true = Len > 0,
 1486:     ok.
 1487: 
 1488: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail() ->
 1489:     process_info(self(),
 1490:                  [message_queue_len,
 1491:                   current_function,
 1492:                   current_location,
 1493:                   current_stacktrace]).
 1494: 
 1495: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(Res) ->
 1496:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1497:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0}},
 1498:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_}},
 1499:      {current_stacktrace,
 1500:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1501:     true = Len > 0,
 1502:     ok.
 1503:     
 1504: 
 1505: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To) ->
 1506:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, 10000000).
 1507: 
 1508: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(_To, 0) ->
 1509:     ok;
 1510: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N) ->
 1511:     To ! hejhopp,
 1512:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1513:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N-1).
 1514: 
 1515: pi_sig_spam_test(SpamFun, PITest, PICheckRes) ->
 1516:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
 1517:     try
 1518:         Self = self(),
 1519:         SigSpammer = spawn_link(SpamFun),
 1520:         process_flag(priority, low),
 1521:         receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1522:         Res = PITest(),
 1523:         process_flag(priority, high),
 1524:         unlink(SigSpammer),
 1525:         exit(SigSpammer, kill),
 1526:         false = is_process_alive(SigSpammer),
 1527:         PICheckRes(Res)
 1528:     after
 1529:         _ = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
 1530:     end.
 1531: 
 1532: process_info_msgq_len_no_very_long_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1533:     Tester = self(),
 1534:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1535:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1536:                     end),
 1537:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1538:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1539:     P2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1540:                             Tester ! hello,
 1541:                             P1 ! hello,
 1542:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1543:                     end),
 1544:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1545:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1546:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1547:     receive hello -> ok end,
 1548:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1549:     unlink(P1),
 1550:     exit(P1, kill),
 1551:     unlink(P2),
 1552:     exit(P2, kill),
 1553:     false = is_process_alive(P1),
 1554:     false = is_process_alive(P2),
 1555:     ok.
 1556: 
 1557: %% Tests erlang:bump_reductions/1.
 1558: bump_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1559:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1560:     erlang:yield(),		% Clear reductions.
 1561:     {reductions,R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1562:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100),
 1563:     {reductions,R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1564:     case R2-R1 of
 1565: 	      Diff when Diff < 100 ->
 1566: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1567: 		  ct:fail({small_diff, Diff});
 1568: 	      Diff when Diff > 110 ->
 1569: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1570: 		  ct:fail({big_diff, Diff});
 1571: 	      Diff ->
 1572: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Diff]),
 1573: 		  ok
 1574: 	  end,
 1575: 
 1576:     %% Make sure that a bignum reduction doesn't crash the emulator (32-bit CPU).
 1577:     bump_big(R2, 16#08000000).
 1578: 
 1579: bump_big(Prev, Limit) ->
 1580:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100000), %Limited to CONTEXT_REDUCTIONS.
 1581:     case process_info(self(), reductions) of
 1582: 	      {reductions,Big} when is_integer(Big), Big > Limit ->
 1583: 		  erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1584: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Big]);
 1585: 	      {reductions,R} when is_integer(R), R > Prev ->
 1586: 		  bump_big(R, Limit)
 1587: 	  end,
 1588:     ok.
 1589: 
 1590: %% Priority 'low' should be mixed with 'normal' using a factor of
 1591: %% about 8. (OTP-2644)
 1592: low_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1593:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1594:     Prop = low_prio_test(Config),
 1595:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1596:     Str = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Low/high proportion is ~.3f",
 1597:                                       [Prop])),
 1598:     {comment,Str}.
 1599: 
 1600: low_prio_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1601:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1602: 
 1603:     %% Spawn the server running with high priority. The server must
 1604:     %% not run at normal priority as that would skew the results for
 1605:     %% two reasons:
 1606:     %%
 1607:     %% 1. There would be one more normal-priority processes than
 1608:     %% low-priority processes.
 1609:     %%
 1610:     %% 2. The receive queue would grow faster than the server process
 1611:     %% could process it. That would in turn trigger the reduction
 1612:     %% punishment for the clients.
 1613:     S = spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_server, [0, 0], [link,{priority,high}]),
 1614: 
 1615:     %% Spawn the clients and let them run for a while.
 1616:     PCs = spawn_prio_clients(S, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1617:     ct:sleep({seconds,2}),
 1618:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, PCs),
 1619: 
 1620:     %% Stop the server and retrieve the result.
 1621:     S ! exit,
 1622:     receive
 1623:         {'EXIT', S, {A, B}} ->
 1624:             check_prio(A, B)
 1625:     end.
 1626: 
 1627: check_prio(A, B) ->
 1628:     Prop = A/B,
 1629:     ok = io:format("Low=~p, High=~p, Prop=~p\n", [A, B, Prop]),
 1630: 
 1631:     %% Prop is expected to be appr. 1/8. Allow a reasonable margin.
 1632:     true = Prop < 1/4,
 1633:     true = Prop > 1/16,
 1634:     Prop.
 1635: 
 1636: prio_server(A, B) ->
 1637:     receive
 1638: 	low ->
 1639: 	    prio_server(A+1, B);
 1640: 	normal ->
 1641: 	    prio_server(A, B+1);
 1642: 	exit ->
 1643: 	    exit({A, B})
 1644:     end.
 1645: 
 1646: spawn_prio_clients(_, 0) ->
 1647:     [];
 1648: spawn_prio_clients(S, N) ->
 1649:     [spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, normal], [link, {priority,normal}]),
 1650:      spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, low], [link, {priority,low}])
 1651:      | spawn_prio_clients(S, N-1)].
 1652: 
 1653: prio_client(S, Prio) ->
 1654:     S ! Prio,
 1655:     prio_client(S, Prio).
 1656: 
 1657: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1658:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 1659:     B;
 1660: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1661:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1662: 
 1663: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1664:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1665:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1666:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1667:     Bin.
 1668: 
 1669: %% Tests erlang:yield/1
 1670: yield(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1671:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1672: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
 1673: 	    {skipped,
 1674: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
 1675: 	     ++ ") is enabled. Testcase gets messed up by modified "
 1676: 	     "timing."};
 1677: 	_ ->
 1678: 	    MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1679: 	    yield_test(),
 1680: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1681: 	    case MS of
 1682: 		blocked ->
 1683: 		    {comment,
 1684: 		     "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
 1685: 		     "was not written to work with multiple schedulers (the "
 1686: 		     "yield2 test-case tests almost the same thing)."};
 1687: 		_ ->
 1688: 		    ok
 1689: 	    end
 1690:     end.
 1691: 
 1692: yield_test() ->
 1693:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1694:     receive after 1 -> ok end,		% Clear reductions.
 1695:     SC = schedcnt(start),
 1696:     {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1697:     {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1698:     true = call_yield(final),
 1699:     true = call_yield(),
 1700:     true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1701:     {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1702:     Schedcnt = schedcnt(stop, SC),
 1703:     case {R2-R1, Schedcnt} of
 1704: 	{Diff, 4} when Diff < 30 ->
 1705: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1706: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]);
 1707: 	{Diff, _} ->
 1708: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1709: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]),
 1710: 	    ct:fail({measurement_error, Diff, Schedcnt})
 1711:     end.
 1712: 
 1713: call_yield() ->
 1714:     erlang:yield().
 1715: 
 1716: call_yield(middle) ->
 1717:     {ok, erlang:yield()};
 1718: call_yield(final) ->
 1719:     case self() of
 1720: 	Self when is_pid(Self) ->
 1721: 	    ok
 1722:     end,
 1723:     erlang:yield().
 1724: 
 1725: schedcnt(start) ->
 1726:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1727:     Fun = 
 1728: 	fun (F, Cnt) ->
 1729: 		receive
 1730: 		    {Ref, Parent} ->
 1731: 			Parent ! {Ref, Cnt}
 1732: 		after 0 ->
 1733: 			erlang:yield(),
 1734: 			F(F, Cnt+1)
 1735: 		end
 1736: 	end,
 1737:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () -> Fun(Fun, 0) end),
 1738:     {Ref, Pid}.
 1739: 
 1740: schedcnt(stop, {Ref, Pid}) when is_reference(Ref), is_pid(Pid) ->
 1741:     Pid ! {Ref, self()},
 1742:     receive
 1743: 	{Ref, Cnt} ->
 1744: 	    Cnt
 1745:     end.
 1746: 
 1747: yield2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1748:     Me = self(),
 1749:     Go = make_ref(),
 1750:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 1751:     Done = make_ref(),
 1752:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 1753: 		receive Go -> ok end,
 1754: 		{reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1755: 		{ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1756: 		true = call_yield(final),
 1757: 		true = call_yield(),
 1758: 		true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1759: 		{reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1760: 		Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 1761: 		exit(Done)
 1762: 	end),
 1763:     erlang:yield(),
 1764: 
 1765:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 1766: 
 1767:     P ! Go,
 1768: 
 1769:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 1770:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1771: 
 1772:     %% {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1773:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1774:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1775: 
 1776:     %% true = call_yield(final),
 1777:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1778:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1779: 
 1780:     %% true = call_yield(),
 1781:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1782:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1783: 
 1784:     %% true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1785:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1786:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1787: 
 1788:     %% exit(Done)
 1789:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 1790: 
 1791: 
 1792:     receive
 1793: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < 30, Reductions > 0 ->
 1794: 		  io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 1795: 		  ok;
 1796: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 1797: 		  ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions})
 1798: 	  end,
 1799: 
 1800:     none = next_tmsg(P),
 1801: 
 1802:     ok.
 1803: 
 1804: next_tmsg(Pid) ->
 1805:     receive
 1806: 	TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 1807: 		  element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 1808: 		  element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 1809: 	    TMsg
 1810:     after 100 ->
 1811: 	    none
 1812:     end.
 1813: 
 1814: dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1815:     %% Verification of nc reference counts when stopping node
 1816:     %% will find the bug if it exists...
 1817:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1818:     ParentFun =
 1819:         fun () ->
 1820:                 %% Give parent some work to do when
 1821:                 %% exiting to increase the likelyhood
 1822:                 %% of the bug triggereing...
 1823:                 T = ets:new(x,[]),
 1824:                 ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 1825:                                                 {I,I}
 1826:                                         end,
 1827:                                         lists:seq(1,10000))),
 1828:                 Chld = spawn_link(Node,
 1829:                                   fun () ->
 1830:                                           receive
 1831:                                           after infinity ->
 1832:                                                   ok
 1833:                                           end
 1834:                                   end),
 1835:                 erlang:yield(),
 1836:                 unlink(Chld),
 1837:                 exit(bye)
 1838:         end,
 1839:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1840:                             spawn_monitor(ParentFun)
 1841:                     end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 1842:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1843:                           receive
 1844:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, bye} ->
 1845:                                   ok
 1846:                           end
 1847:                   end, PMs),
 1848:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1849:     ok.
 1850: 
 1851: %% Test that bad arguments to register/2 cause an exception.
 1852: bad_register(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1853:     Name = a_long_and_unused_name,
 1854: 
 1855:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register({bad,name}, self())),
 1856:     fail_register(undefined, self()),
 1857:     fail_register([bad,name], self()),
 1858: 
 1859:     {Dead,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> true end),
 1860:     receive
 1861: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Dead,_} -> ok
 1862:     end,
 1863:     fail_register(Name, Dead),
 1864:     fail_register(Name, make_ref()),
 1865:     fail_register(Name, []),
 1866:     fail_register(Name, {bad,process}),
 1867:     fail_register(Name, <<>>),
 1868:     ok.
 1869: 
 1870: fail_register(Name, Process) ->
 1871:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register(Name, Process)),
 1872:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Name ! anything_goes),
 1873:     ok.
 1874: 
 1875: garbage_collect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1876:     Prio = process_flag(priority, high),
 1877:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1878:     
 1879:     TokLoopers = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1880: 		spawn_opt(fun tok_loop/0, [{priority, low}, link])
 1881: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 1882: 
 1883:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1884: 		Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1885: 		DownBefore = receive
 1886: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 1887: 			true
 1888: 		after 0 ->
 1889: 			false
 1890: 		end,
 1891: 		GC = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1892: 		DownAfter = receive
 1893: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 1894: 			true
 1895: 		after 0 ->
 1896: 			false
 1897: 		end,
 1898: 		true = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1899: 		case {DownBefore, DownAfter} of
 1900: 		    {true, _} -> false = GC;
 1901: 		    {false, false} -> true = GC;
 1902: 		    _ -> GC
 1903: 		end
 1904: 	end, processes()),
 1905: 
 1906:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1907: 		unlink(Pid),
 1908: 		exit(Pid, bang)
 1909: 	end, TokLoopers),
 1910:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
 1911:     ok.
 1912: 
 1913: %% This used to cause the nofrag emulator to dump core
 1914: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1915:     process_info_messages_test(),
 1916:     ok.
 1917: 
 1918: process_info_messages_loop(0) -> ok;
 1919: process_info_messages_loop(N) -> process_info_messages_loop(N-1).
 1920: 
 1921: process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr) ->
 1922:     receive
 1923: 	Msg ->
 1924: 	    Rcvr ! Msg,
 1925: 	    process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr)
 1926:     after 0 ->
 1927: 	    ok
 1928:     end.
 1929: 
 1930: process_info_messages_test() ->
 1931:     Go = make_ref(),
 1932:     Done = make_ref(),
 1933:     Rcvr = self(),
 1934:     Rcvr2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1935: 		receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 1936: 		garbage_collect(),
 1937: 		Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 1938: 	end),
 1939:     Sndrs = lists:map(
 1940: 	fun (_) ->
 1941: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 1942: 			    Rcvr ! {Go, self()},
 1943: 			    receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 1944: 			    BigData = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 1945: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 1946: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 1947: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 1948: 			    Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 1949: 		    end)
 1950: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 1951:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Go, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 1952: 			Sndrs),
 1953:     garbage_collect(),
 1954:     erlang:yield(),
 1955:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> Sndr ! {Go, self()} end, Sndrs),
 1956:     process_info_messages_loop(100000000),
 1957:     Msgs = process_info(self(), messages),
 1958:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Done, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 1959: 			Sndrs),
 1960:     garbage_collect(),
 1961:     Rcvr2 ! Msgs,
 1962:     process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr2),
 1963:     Rcvr2 ! {Go, self()},
 1964:     garbage_collect(),
 1965:     receive {Done, Rcvr2} -> ok end,
 1966:     Msgs.
 1967: 
 1968: chk_badarg(Fun) ->
 1969:     try Fun(), exit(no_badarg) catch error:badarg -> ok end.
 1970: 
 1971: process_flag_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1972:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, banan) end),
 1973:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(trap_exit, gurka) end),
 1974:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(error_handler, 1) end),
 1975:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(fullsweep_after, gurka) end),
 1976:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_heap_size, gurka) end),
 1977:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, gurka) end),
 1978:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, -1) end),
 1979: 
 1980:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, gurka) end),
 1981:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, -1) end),
 1982:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 1983:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 1984:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, Min - 1)
 1985:                end),
 1986:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 1987:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 1988:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, #{size => Min - 1})
 1989:                end),
 1990:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{}) end),
 1991:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ kill => true }) end),
 1992:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1993:                                                         kill => gurka }) end),
 1994:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1995:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 1996:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1997:                                                         include_shared_binaries => gurka}) end),
 1998:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1999:                                                         kill => true,
 2000:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2001:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 1 bsl 64 }) end),
 2002: 
 2003:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(priority, 4711) end),
 2004:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2005:     {P,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> receive "in vain" -> no end end),
 2006:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2007:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2008:     exit(P, die),
 2009:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2010:     {'DOWN', Mref, process, P, die} = receive M -> M end,
 2011:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2012:     ok.
 2013: 
 2014: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").
 2015: 
 2016: otp_6237(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2017:     Slctrs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2018: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2019: 			    otp_6237_select_loop()
 2020: 		    end)
 2021: 	end,
 2022: 	lists:seq(1,5)),
 2023:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> otp_6237_test() end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 2024:     lists:foreach(fun (S) -> unlink(S),exit(S, kill) end, Slctrs), 
 2025:     ok.
 2026: 				
 2027: otp_6237_test() ->
 2028:     Parent = self(),
 2029:     Inited = make_ref(),
 2030:     Die = make_ref(),
 2031:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2032: 		register(otp_6237,self()),
 2033: 		otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2034: 		    [named_table,
 2035: 			ordered_set]),
 2036: 		ets:insert(otp_6237,
 2037: 		    [{I,I}
 2038: 			|| I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 2039: 		%% Inserting a lot of bif timers
 2040: 		%% increase the possibility that
 2041: 		%% the test will fail when the
 2042: 		%% original cleanup order is used
 2043: 		lists:foreach( fun (_) ->
 2044: 			    erlang:send_after(1000000, self(), {a,b,c})
 2045: 		    end, lists:seq(1,1000)),
 2046: 		Parent ! Inited,
 2047: 		receive Die -> bye end
 2048: 	end),
 2049:     receive
 2050: 	Inited -> ok
 2051:     end,
 2052:     Pid ! Die,
 2053:     otp_6237_whereis_loop().
 2054: 
 2055: otp_6237_whereis_loop() ->
 2056:     case whereis(otp_6237) of
 2057: 	      undefined ->
 2058: 		  otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2059: 					   [named_table,ordered_set]),
 2060: 		  ets:delete(otp_6237),
 2061: 		  ok;
 2062: 	      _ ->
 2063: 		  otp_6237_whereis_loop()
 2064: 	  end.
 2065: 	     
 2066: otp_6237_select_loop() ->
 2067:     catch ets:select(otp_6237, ets:fun2ms(fun({K, does_not_exist}) -> K end)),
 2068:     otp_6237_select_loop().
 2069: 
 2070: 
 2071: -define(NoTestProcs, 10000).
 2072: -record(ptab_list_bif_info, {min_start_reds,
 2073: 			     tab_chunks,
 2074: 			     tab_chunks_size,
 2075: 			     tab_indices_per_red,
 2076: 			     free_term_proc_reds,
 2077: 			     term_procs_per_red,
 2078: 			     term_procs_max_reds,
 2079: 			     conses_per_red,
 2080: 			     debug_level}).
 2081: 
 2082: processes_large_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2083:     sys_mem_cond_run(2048, fun () -> processes_large_tab_test() end).
 2084: 
 2085: processes_large_tab_test() ->
 2086:     enable_internal_state(),
 2087:     MaxDbgLvl = 20,
 2088:     MinProcTabSize = 2*(1 bsl 15),
 2089:     ProcTabSize0 = 1000000,
 2090:     ProcTabSize1 = case {erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2091: 	    erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 2092: 	{Schdlrs, Cpus} when is_integer(Cpus),
 2093: 	Schdlrs =< Cpus ->
 2094: 	    ProcTabSize0;
 2095: 	_ ->
 2096: 	    ProcTabSize0 div 4
 2097:     end,
 2098:     BT = erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2099:     ProcTabSize2 = case (BT =:= debug) or (BT =:= valgrind) of
 2100: 	true -> ProcTabSize1 - 500000;
 2101: 	false -> ProcTabSize1
 2102:     end,
 2103:     %% With high debug levels this test takes so long time that
 2104:     %% the connection times out; therefore, shrink the test on
 2105:     %% high debug levels.
 2106:     DbgLvl = case erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info) of
 2107: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl > MaxDbgLvl ->
 2108: 			   20;
 2109: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl < 0 ->
 2110: 			   ct:fail({debug_level, Lvl});
 2111: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} ->
 2112: 			   Lvl
 2113: 		   end,
 2114:     ProcTabSize3 = ProcTabSize2 - (1300000 * DbgLvl div MaxDbgLvl),
 2115:     ProcTabSize = case ProcTabSize3 < MinProcTabSize of
 2116: 			    true -> MinProcTabSize;
 2117: 			    false -> ProcTabSize3
 2118: 			end,
 2119:     {ok, Peer, LargeNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P", integer_to_list(ProcTabSize)]),
 2120:     Res = rpc:call(LargeNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2121:     case rpc:call(LargeNode,
 2122: 			erts_debug,
 2123: 			get_internal_state,
 2124: 			[processes_bif_info]) of
 2125: 	      #ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when is_integer(Chunks),
 2126: 							    Chunks > 1 -> ok;
 2127: 	      PBInfo -> ct:fail(PBInfo)
 2128: 	  end,
 2129:     stop_node(Peer, LargeNode),
 2130:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2131: 
 2132: processes_default_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2133:     sys_mem_cond_run(1024, fun () -> processes_default_tab_test() end).
 2134: 
 2135: processes_default_tab_test() ->
 2136:     {ok, Peer, DefaultNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2137:     Res = rpc:call(DefaultNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2138:     stop_node(Peer, DefaultNode),
 2139:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2140: 
 2141: processes_small_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2142:     {ok, Peer, SmallNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P","1024"]),
 2143:     Res    = rpc:call(SmallNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2144:     PBInfo = rpc:call(SmallNode, erts_debug, get_internal_state, [processes_bif_info]),
 2145:     stop_node(Peer, SmallNode),
 2146:     true = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.tab_chunks < 10,
 2147:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2148: 
 2149: processes_this_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2150:     Mem = case {erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2151:                 erlang:system_info(allocator)} of
 2152:               {lcnt, {_, _Vsn, [sys_alloc], _Opts}} ->
 2153:                   %% When running +Mea min + lcnt we may need more memory
 2154:                   1024 * 4;
 2155:               _ ->
 2156:                   1024
 2157:           end,
 2158:     sys_mem_cond_run(Mem, fun () -> chk_processes_bif_test_res(processes_bif_test()) end).
 2159: 
 2160: chk_processes_bif_test_res(ok) -> ok;
 2161: chk_processes_bif_test_res({comment, _} = Comment) -> Comment;
 2162: chk_processes_bif_test_res(Failure) -> ct:fail(Failure).
 2163: 
 2164: print_processes_bif_info(#ptab_list_bif_info{min_start_reds = MinStartReds,
 2165: 					     tab_chunks = TabChunks,
 2166: 					     tab_chunks_size = TabChunksSize,
 2167: 					     tab_indices_per_red = TabIndPerRed,
 2168: 					     free_term_proc_reds = FreeTPReds,
 2169: 					     term_procs_per_red = TPPerRed,
 2170: 					     term_procs_max_reds = TPMaxReds,
 2171: 					     conses_per_red = ConsesPerRed,
 2172: 					     debug_level = DbgLvl}) ->
 2173:     io:format("processes/0 bif info on node ~p:~n"
 2174: 	      "Min start reductions = ~p~n"
 2175: 	      "Process table chunks = ~p~n"
 2176: 	      "Process table chunks size = ~p~n"
 2177: 	      "Process table indices per reduction = ~p~n"
 2178: 	      "Reduction cost for free() on terminated process struct = ~p~n"
 2179: 	      "Inspect terminated processes per reduction = ~p~n"
 2180: 	      "Max reductions during inspection of terminated processes = ~p~n"
 2181: 	      "Create cons-cells per reduction = ~p~n"
 2182: 	      "Debug level = ~p~n",
 2183: 	      [node(),
 2184: 	       MinStartReds,
 2185: 	       TabChunks,
 2186: 	       TabChunksSize,
 2187: 	       TabIndPerRed,
 2188: 	       FreeTPReds,
 2189: 	       TPPerRed,
 2190: 	       TPMaxReds,
 2191: 	       ConsesPerRed,
 2192: 	       DbgLvl]).
 2193: 
 2194: processes_bif_cleaner() ->
 2195:     receive {'EXIT', _, _} -> ok end,
 2196:     processes_bif_cleaner().
 2197: 
 2198: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner) ->
 2199:     TabSz = erlang:system_info(process_limit),
 2200:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid,TabSz),
 2201:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner,
 2202: 			      TabSz,
 2203: 			      TabSz*2,
 2204: 			      0,
 2205: 			      []).
 2206: 
 2207: processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs) ->
 2208:     ProcInfo = [registered_name,
 2209: 		initial_call,
 2210: 		current_function,
 2211: 		status,
 2212: 		priority],
 2213:     MissingProcs = CorrectProcs -- Procs,
 2214:     io:format("Missing processes: ~p",
 2215: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2216: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2217: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2218: 					undefined -> [];
 2219: 					Res -> Res
 2220: 				    end]
 2221: 			 end,
 2222: 			 MissingProcs)]),
 2223:     SuperfluousProcs = Procs -- CorrectProcs,
 2224:     io:format("Superfluous processes: ~p",
 2225: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2226: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2227: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2228: 					undefined -> [];
 2229: 					Res -> Res
 2230: 				    end]
 2231: 			 end,
 2232: 			 SuperfluousProcs)]),
 2233:     ct:fail(unexpected_result).
 2234: 
 2235: hangaround(Cleaner, Type) ->
 2236:     %% Type is only used to distinguish different processes from
 2237:     %% when doing process_info
 2238:     try link(Cleaner) catch error:Reason -> exit(Reason) end,
 2239:     receive after infinity -> ok end,
 2240:     exit(Type).
 2241: 
 2242: spawn_initial_hangarounds(_Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) when NP > Max ->
 2243:     {Len, HAs};
 2244: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) ->
 2245:     Skip = 30,
 2246:     wait_for_proc_slots(Skip+3),
 2247:     HA1 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2248: 		    [{priority, low}]),
 2249:     HA2 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2250: 		    [{priority, normal}]),
 2251:     HA3 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2252: 		    [{priority, high}]),
 2253:     spawn_drop(Skip),
 2254:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP+Skip, Max, Len+3, [HA1,HA2,HA3|HAs]).
 2255: 
 2256: wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots) ->
 2257:     case erlang:system_info(process_limit) - erlang:system_info(process_count) of
 2258:         FreeSlots when FreeSlots < MinFreeSlots ->
 2259:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 2260:             wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots);
 2261:         _FreeSlots ->
 2262:             ok
 2263:     end.
 2264: 
 2265: spawn_drop(N) when N =< 0 ->
 2266:     ok;
 2267: spawn_drop(N) ->
 2268:     spawn(fun () -> ok end),
 2269:     spawn_drop(N-1).
 2270: 
 2271: do_processes(WantReds) ->
 2272:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2273:     processes().
 2274: 
 2275: processes_bif_test() ->
 2276:     Tester = self(),
 2277:     enable_internal_state(),
 2278:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2279:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2280:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2281:     WillTrap = case PBInfo of
 2282: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when Chunks < 10 ->
 2283: 	    false; %% Skip for small tables
 2284: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks,
 2285: 	    tab_chunks_size = ChunksSize,
 2286: 	    tab_indices_per_red = IndiciesPerRed
 2287: 	} ->
 2288: 	    Chunks*ChunksSize >= IndiciesPerRed*WantReds
 2289:     end,
 2290:     Processes = fun () ->
 2291: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2292: 	    processes()
 2293:     end,
 2294: 
 2295:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2296: 
 2297:     case WillTrap of
 2298: 	false ->
 2299: 	    ok;
 2300: 	true ->
 2301: 	    %% Do it against with a process suspended while
 2302: 	    %% in the processes/0 bif.
 2303: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2304: 	    Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2305: 						 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2306: 						 Tester ! {self(),
 2307: 							   done,
 2308: 							   hd(Processes())},
 2309: 						 receive
 2310: 						 after infinity ->
 2311: 							 ok
 2312: 						 end
 2313: 					 end),
 2314: 	    receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2315: 	    erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2316: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2317: 	    
 2318: 	    [{status,suspended},{current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}] =
 2319: 		process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2320: 
 2321: 	    ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2322: 	    
 2323: 	    erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2324: 	    receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2325: 	    unlink(Suspendee),
 2326: 	    exit(Suspendee, bang)
 2327:     end,
 2328:     case get(processes_bif_testcase_comment) of
 2329: 	undefined -> ok;
 2330: 	Comment -> {comment, Comment}
 2331:     end.
 2332:     
 2333: do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, DieTest, Processes) ->
 2334:     Tester = self(),
 2335:     SpawnProcesses = fun (Prio) ->
 2336: 	    spawn_opt(?MODULE, do_processes, [WantReds], [link, {priority, Prio}])
 2337:     end,
 2338:     Cleaner = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2339: 		process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2340: 		Tester ! {cleaner_alive, self()},
 2341: 		processes_bif_cleaner()
 2342: 	end),
 2343:     receive {cleaner_alive, Cleaner} -> ok end,
 2344:     try
 2345: 	DoIt = make_ref(),
 2346: 	GetGoing = make_ref(),
 2347: 	{NoTestProcs, TestProcs} = spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner),
 2348: 	io:format("Testing with ~p processes~n", [NoTestProcs]),
 2349: 	SpawnHangAround = fun () ->
 2350: 		spawn(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, new_hangaround])
 2351: 	end,
 2352: 	Killer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2353: 		    Splt = NoTestProcs div 10,
 2354: 		    {TP1, TP23} = lists:split(Splt, TestProcs),
 2355: 		    {TP2, TP3} = lists:split(Splt, TP23),
 2356: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2357: 		    Tester ! DoIt,
 2358: 		    receive GetGoing -> ok end,
 2359: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2360: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2361: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2362: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2363: 				exit(P, bang)
 2364: 			end, TP1),
 2365: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2366: 		    erlang:yield(),
 2367: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2368: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2369: 				exit(P, bang)
 2370: 			end, TP2),
 2371: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2372: 		    lists:foreach(
 2373: 			fun (P) ->
 2374: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2375: 				exit(P, bang)
 2376: 			end, TP3)
 2377: 	    end, [{priority, high}, link]),
 2378: 	receive DoIt -> ok end,
 2379: 	process_flag(priority, low),
 2380: 	SpawnProcesses(low),
 2381: 	erlang:yield(),
 2382: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2383: 	CorrectProcs0 = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes),
 2384: 	Killer ! GetGoing,
 2385: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2386: 	Procs0 = processes(),
 2387: 	Procs = lists:sort(Procs0),
 2388: 	CorrectProcs = lists:sort(CorrectProcs0),
 2389: 	LengthCorrectProcs = length(CorrectProcs),
 2390: 	io:format("~p = length(CorrectProcs)~n", [LengthCorrectProcs]),
 2391: 	true = LengthCorrectProcs > NoTestProcs,
 2392: 	case CorrectProcs =:= Procs of
 2393: 	    true ->
 2394: 		ok;
 2395: 	    false ->
 2396: 		processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs)
 2397: 	end,
 2398: 	unlink(Killer),
 2399: 	exit(Killer, bang)
 2400:     after
 2401: 	unlink(Cleaner),
 2402:         exit(Cleaner, kill),
 2403:         %% Wait for the system to recover to a normal state...
 2404: 	wait_until_system_recover()
 2405:     end,
 2406:     do_processes_bif_die_test(DieTest, Processes),
 2407:     ok.
 2408: 
 2409: 
 2410: do_processes_bif_die_test(false, _Processes) ->
 2411:     io:format("Skipping test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2412:     ok;
 2413: do_processes_bif_die_test(true, Processes) ->
 2414:     do_processes_bif_die_test(5, Processes);
 2415: do_processes_bif_die_test(N, Processes) ->
 2416:     io:format("Doing test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2417:     try
 2418: 	Tester = self(),
 2419: 	Oooh_Nooooooo = make_ref(),
 2420: 	{_, DieWhileDoingMon} = erlang:spawn_monitor( fun () ->
 2421: 		    Victim = self(),
 2422: 		    spawn_opt(
 2423: 			fun () ->
 2424: 				exit(Victim, got_him)
 2425: 			end,
 2426: 			[link, {priority, max}]),
 2427: 		    Tester ! {Oooh_Nooooooo,
 2428: 			hd(Processes())},
 2429: 		    exit(ohhhh_nooooo)
 2430: 	    end),
 2431: 	receive
 2432: 	    {'DOWN', DieWhileDoingMon, _, _, Reason} ->
 2433: 		case Reason of
 2434: 		    got_him -> ok;
 2435: 		    _ -> throw({kill_in_trap, Reason})
 2436: 		end
 2437: 	end,
 2438: 	receive
 2439: 	    {Oooh_Nooooooo, _} ->
 2440: 		throw({kill_in_trap, 'Oooh_Nooooooo'})
 2441: 	after 0 ->
 2442: 		ok
 2443: 	end,
 2444: 	PrcsCllrsSeqLen = 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2445: 	PrcsCllrsSeq = lists:seq(1, PrcsCllrsSeqLen),
 2446: 	ProcsCallers = lists:map( fun (_) ->
 2447: 		    spawn_link(
 2448: 			fun () ->
 2449: 				Tester ! hd(Processes())
 2450: 			end)
 2451: 	    end, PrcsCllrsSeq),
 2452: 	erlang:yield(),
 2453: 	{ProcsCallers1, ProcsCallers2} = lists:split(PrcsCllrsSeqLen div 2,
 2454: 						     ProcsCallers),
 2455: 	process_flag(priority, high),
 2456: 	lists:foreach(
 2457: 		fun (P) ->
 2458: 			unlink(P),
 2459: 			exit(P, bang)
 2460: 		end,
 2461: 		lists:reverse(ProcsCallers2) ++ ProcsCallers1),
 2462: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2463: 	ok
 2464:     catch
 2465: 	throw:{kill_in_trap, R} when N > 0 ->
 2466: 	    io:format("Failed to kill in trap: ~p~n", [R]),
 2467: 	    io:format("Trying again~n", []),
 2468: 	    do_processes_bif_die_test(N-1, Processes)
 2469:     end.
 2470: 	    
 2471: 
 2472: wait_until_system_recover() ->
 2473:     %% If system hasn't recovered after 10 seconds we give up
 2474:     Tmr = erlang:start_timer(10000, self(), no_more_wait),
 2475:     wait_until_system_recover(Tmr).
 2476: 
 2477: wait_until_system_recover(Tmr) ->
 2478:     try
 2479: 	lists:foreach(fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2480: 			      ok;
 2481: 			  (P) ->
 2482: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2483: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _}} ->
 2484: 				      throw(wait);
 2485: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2486: 				      ok;
 2487: 				  undefined ->
 2488: 				      ok
 2489: 			      end
 2490: 		      end,
 2491: 		      processes())
 2492:     catch
 2493: 	throw:wait ->
 2494: 	    receive
 2495: 		{timeout, Tmr, _} ->
 2496: 		    Comment = "WARNING: Test processes still hanging around!",
 2497: 		    io:format("~s~n", [Comment]),
 2498: 		    put(processes_bif_testcase_comment, Comment),
 2499: 		    lists:foreach(
 2500: 		      fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2501: 			      ok;
 2502: 			  (P) ->
 2503: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2504: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _} = MFA} ->
 2505: 				      io:format("~p ~p~n", [P, MFA]);
 2506: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2507: 				      ok;
 2508: 				  undefined ->
 2509: 				      ok
 2510: 			      end
 2511: 		      end,
 2512: 		      processes())
 2513: 	    after 100 ->
 2514: 		    wait_until_system_recover(Tmr)
 2515: 	    end
 2516:     end,
 2517:     erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr),
 2518:     receive {timeout, Tmr, _} -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2519:     ok.
 2520: 
 2521: processes_last_call_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2522:     enable_internal_state(),
 2523:     Processes = fun () -> processes() end,
 2524:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2525:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2526:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2527: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2528: 	_R -> 9
 2529:     end,
 2530:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2531: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2532: 		    WantReds),
 2533: 		Processes(),
 2534: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2535: 		    WantReds),
 2536: 		my_processes()
 2537: 	end,
 2538: 	lists:seq(1,100)).
 2539:     
 2540: my_processes() ->
 2541:     processes().
 2542: 
 2543: processes_apply_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2544:     enable_internal_state(),
 2545:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2546:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2547:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2548: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2549: 	_R -> 9
 2550:     end,
 2551:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2552: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2553: 		    WantReds),
 2554: 		apply(erlang, processes, [])
 2555: 	end, lists:seq(1,100)).
 2556: 
 2557: processes_gc_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2558:     Tester = self(),
 2559:     enable_internal_state(),
 2560:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2561:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2562:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2563:     Processes = fun () ->
 2564: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2565: 	    processes()
 2566:     end,
 2567: 
 2568:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2569:     Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2570: 					 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2571: 					 Tester ! {self(),
 2572: 						   done,
 2573: 						   hd(Processes())},
 2574: 					 receive after infinity -> ok end
 2575: 				 end),
 2576:     receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2577:     erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2578:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2579: 	    
 2580:     [{status,suspended}, {current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}]
 2581: 	= process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2582: 
 2583:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2584:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2585: 	    
 2586:     erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2587:     receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2588:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2589:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2590: 
 2591:     unlink(Suspendee),
 2592:     exit(Suspendee, bang),
 2593:     ok.
 2594: 
 2595: process_flag_fullsweep_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2596:     {fullsweep_after, OldFSA} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2597:     OldFSA = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 12345),
 2598:     {fullsweep_after, 12345} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2599:     12345 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
 2600:     {fullsweep_after, 0} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2601:     0 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, OldFSA),
 2602:     ok.
 2603: 
 2604: process_flag_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2605:     HSize  = 2586,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2606:     VHSize = 318187, % must be gc fib+ number
 2607:     OldHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, HSize),
 2608:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2609:     OldVHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize),
 2610:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
 2611:     HSize = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, OldHmin),
 2612:     VHSize = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, OldVHmin),
 2613:     ok.
 2614: 
 2615: %% test that max_heap_size is correctly handled when passed via command line
 2616: command_line_max_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2617:     %% test maximum heap size
 2618:     HMax = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 2619:                8 -> (1 bsl 59) - 1;
 2620:                4 -> (1 bsl 27) - 1
 2621:            end,
 2622:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmax", integer_to_list(HMax)]),
 2623:     Pid = erlang:spawn(Node, fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 2624:     {max_heap_size, #{size := HMax}} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [Pid, max_heap_size]),
 2625:     peer:stop(Peer).
 2626: 
 2627: spawn_opt_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2628:     HSize  = 987,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2629:     VHSize = 46422, % must be gc fib+ number
 2630:     Pid  = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end,
 2631: 	[{min_heap_size, HSize},{ min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize}]),
 2632:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
 2633:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
 2634:     Pid ! stop,
 2635:     ok.
 2636: 
 2637: spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 2638: 
 2639:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 2640: 
 2641:     %% flush any prior messages in error_logger
 2642:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> ok = nok end),
 2643:     receive
 2644:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2645:             flush()
 2646:     end,
 2647: 
 2648:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_fun/1),
 2649: 
 2650:     io:format("Repeat tests with refc binaries\n",[]),
 2651: 
 2652:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_bin_fun/1),
 2653: 
 2654:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
 2655:     ok.
 2656: 
 2657: spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(OomFun) ->
 2658:     Max = 2024,
 2659:     %% Test that numerical limit works
 2660:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2661: 
 2662:     %% Test that map limit works
 2663:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2664: 
 2665:     %% Test that no kill is sent
 2666:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => false }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 2667: 
 2668:     %% Test that no error_logger report is sent
 2669:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => false }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 2670: 
 2671:     %% Test that system_flag works
 2672:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => false,
 2673:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 2674:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 2675:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2676: 
 2677:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2678:                                                 error_logger => false})),
 2679:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 2680:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2681: 
 2682:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 1 bsl 16, kill => true,
 2683:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 2684:     max_heap_size_test(#{ }, 1 bsl 16, true, true, OomFun),
 2685: 
 2686:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2687:                                          error_logger => true}),
 2688: 
 2689:     %% Test that ordinary case works as expected again
 2690:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2691:     ok.
 2692: 
 2693: 
 2694: mhs_spawn_opt(Option) when map_get(size, Option) > 0;
 2695:                            is_integer(Option) ->
 2696:     [{max_heap_size, Option}];
 2697: mhs_spawn_opt(_) ->
 2698:     [].
 2699: 
 2700: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger, OomFun) ->
 2701:     SpOpt = mhs_spawn_opt(OomFun(Option)),
 2702:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun()-> OomFun(run) end, SpOpt),
 2703:     {max_heap_size, MHSz} = erlang:process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
 2704:     ct:log("Default: ~p~nOption: ~p~nProc: ~p~nSize = ~p~nSpOpt = ~p~n",
 2705:            [erlang:system_info(max_heap_size), Option, MHSz, Size, SpOpt]),
 2706: 
 2707:     #{ size := Size} = MHSz,
 2708: 
 2709:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2710:     if Kill ->
 2711:             receive
 2712:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 2713:                     killed = Reason
 2714:             end;
 2715:        true ->
 2716:             ok
 2717:     end,
 2718:     if ErrorLogger ->
 2719:             receive
 2720:                 %% There must be at least one error message.
 2721:                 {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2722:                     ok
 2723:             end;
 2724:        true ->
 2725:             ok
 2726:     end,
 2727:     if not Kill ->
 2728:             exit(Pid, die),
 2729:             receive
 2730:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, die} ->
 2731:                     ok
 2732:             end,
 2733:             %% If the process was not killed, the limit may have
 2734:             %% been reached more than once and there may be
 2735:             %% more {error, ...} messages left.
 2736:             receive_error_messages(Pid);
 2737:        true ->
 2738:             ok
 2739:     end,
 2740: 
 2741:     %% Make sure that there are no unexpected messages.
 2742:     receive_unexpected().
 2743: 
 2744: oom_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> Max;
 2745: oom_fun(Map) when is_map(Map)-> Map;
 2746: oom_fun(run) ->
 2747:     io:format("oom_fun() started\n",[]),
 2748:     oom_run_fun([], 100).
 2749: 
 2750: oom_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 2751:     done;
 2752: oom_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 2753:     %% This is tail-recursive since the compiler is smart enough to figure
 2754:     %% out that a body-recursive variant never returns, and loops forever
 2755:     %% without keeping the list alive.
 2756:     timer:sleep(5),
 2757:     oom_run_fun([lists:seq(1, 1000) | Acc0], N-1).
 2758: 
 2759: oom_bin_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> oom_bin_fun(#{size => Max});
 2760: oom_bin_fun(Map) when is_map(Map) -> Map#{include_shared_binaries => true};
 2761: oom_bin_fun(run) ->
 2762:     oom_bin_run_fun([], 10).
 2763: 
 2764: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 2765:     done;
 2766: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 2767:     timer:sleep(5),
 2768:     oom_bin_run_fun([build_refc_bin(160, <<>>) | Acc0], N-1).
 2769: 
 2770: build_refc_bin(0, Acc) ->
 2771:     Acc;
 2772: build_refc_bin(N, Acc) ->
 2773:     build_refc_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary, 0:(1000*8)>>).
 2774: 
 2775: 
 2776: receive_error_messages(Pid) ->
 2777:     receive
 2778:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2779:             receive_error_messages(Pid)
 2780:     after 1000 ->
 2781:             ok
 2782:     end.
 2783: 
 2784: receive_unexpected() ->
 2785:     receive
 2786:         {info_report, _, _} ->
 2787:             %% May be an alarm message from os_mon. Ignore.
 2788:             receive_unexpected();
 2789:         M ->
 2790:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, M})
 2791:     after 10 ->
 2792:             ok
 2793:     end.
 2794: 
 2795: flush() ->
 2796:     receive
 2797:         _M -> flush()
 2798:     after 0 ->
 2799:             ok
 2800:     end.
 2801: 
 2802: %% Make sure that when maximum allowed heap size is exceeded, the
 2803: %% process will actually terminate.
 2804: %%
 2805: %% Despite the timetrap and limit of number of iterations, bugs
 2806: %% provoked by the test case can cause the runtime system to hang in
 2807: %% this test case.
 2808: more_spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 2809:     ct:timetrap({minutes,1}),
 2810:     Funs = [fun build_and_bif/0,
 2811:             fun build_bin_and_bif/0,
 2812:             fun build_and_recv_timeout/0,
 2813:             fun build_and_recv_msg/0,
 2814:             fun bif_and_recv_timeout/0,
 2815:             fun bif_and_recv_msg/0
 2816:            ],
 2817:     _ = [begin
 2818:              {Pid,Ref} = spawn_opt(F, [{max_heap_size,
 2819:                                         #{size => 233, kill => true,
 2820:                                           error_logger => false}},
 2821:                                        monitor]),
 2822:              io:format("~p ~p\n", [Pid,F]),
 2823:              receive
 2824:                  {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
 2825:                      killed = Reason
 2826:              end
 2827:          end || F <- Funs],
 2828:     ok.
 2829: 
 2830: %% This number should be greater than the default heap size.
 2831: -define(MANY_ITERATIONS, 10_000).
 2832: 
 2833: build_and_bif() ->
 2834:     build_and_bif(?MANY_ITERATIONS, []).
 2835: 
 2836: build_and_bif(0, Acc0) ->
 2837:     Acc0;
 2838: build_and_bif(N, Acc0) ->
 2839:     Acc = [0|Acc0],
 2840:     _ = erlang:crc32(Acc),
 2841:     build_and_bif(N-1, Acc).
 2842: 
 2843: build_bin_and_bif() ->
 2844:     build_bin_and_bif(?MANY_ITERATIONS, <<>>).
 2845: 
 2846: build_bin_and_bif(0, Acc0) ->
 2847:     Acc0;
 2848: build_bin_and_bif(N, Acc0) ->
 2849:     Acc = <<0, Acc0/binary>>,
 2850:     _ = erlang:crc32(Acc),
 2851:     build_bin_and_bif(N-1, Acc).
 2852: 
 2853: build_and_recv_timeout() ->
 2854:     build_and_recv_timeout(?MANY_ITERATIONS, []).
 2855: 
 2856: build_and_recv_timeout(0, Acc0) ->
 2857:     Acc0;
 2858: build_and_recv_timeout(N, Acc0) ->
 2859:     Acc = [0|Acc0],
 2860:     receive
 2861:     after 1 ->
 2862:             ok
 2863:     end,
 2864:     build_and_recv_timeout(N-1, Acc).
 2865: 
 2866: build_and_recv_msg() ->
 2867:     build_and_recv_msg(?MANY_ITERATIONS, []).
 2868: 
 2869: build_and_recv_msg(0, Acc0) ->
 2870:     Acc0;
 2871: build_and_recv_msg(N, Acc0) ->
 2872:     Acc = [0|Acc0],
 2873:     receive
 2874:         _ ->
 2875:             ok
 2876:     after 0 ->
 2877:             ok
 2878:     end,
 2879:     build_and_recv_msg(N-1, Acc).
 2880: 
 2881: bif_and_recv_timeout() ->
 2882:     Bin = <<0:?MANY_ITERATIONS/unit:8>>,
 2883:     bif_and_recv_timeout(Bin).
 2884: 
 2885: bif_and_recv_timeout(Bin) ->
 2886:     List = binary_to_list(Bin),
 2887:     receive
 2888:     after 1 ->
 2889:             ok
 2890:     end,
 2891:     List.
 2892: 
 2893: bif_and_recv_msg() ->
 2894:     Bin = <<0:?MANY_ITERATIONS/unit:8>>,
 2895:     bif_and_recv_msg(Bin).
 2896: 
 2897: bif_and_recv_msg(Bin) ->
 2898:     List = binary_to_list(Bin),
 2899:     receive
 2900:         _ ->
 2901:             ok
 2902:     after 0 ->
 2903:             ok
 2904:     end,
 2905:     List.
 2906: 
 2907: %% error_logger report handler proxy
 2908: init(Pid) ->
 2909:     {ok, Pid}.
 2910: 
 2911: handle_event(Event, Pid) ->
 2912:     Pid ! Event,
 2913:     {ok, Pid}.
 2914: 
 2915: huge_arglist_child(A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9,
 2916:                    A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16, A17, A18, A19,

 2918:                    A30, A31, A32, A33, A34, A35, A36, A37, A38, A39,

 2969: spawn_huge_arglist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2970:     %% Huge in two different ways; encoded size and
 2971:     %% length...
 2972:     ArgListHead = [make_ref(),
 2973:                    lists:duplicate(1000000, $a),
 2974:                    <<1:8388608>>,
 2975:                    processes(),
 2976:                    erlang:ports(),
 2977:                    {hej, hopp},
 2978:                    <<17:8388608>>,
 2979:                    lists:duplicate(3000000, $x),
 2980:                    #{ a => 1, b => 2, c => 3, d => 4, e => 5}],
 2981:     ArgList = ArgListHead ++ lists:seq(1, 255 - length(ArgListHead)),
 2982: 
 2983:     io:format("size(term_to_binary(ArgList)) = ~p~n",
 2984:               [size(term_to_binary(ArgList))]),
 2985: 
 2986:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on local node...~n", []),
 2987:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(true, node(), ArgList),
 2988:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on local node with Node...~n", []),
 2989:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(false, node(), ArgList),
 2990:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2991:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
 2992:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on remote node ~p...~n", [Node]),
 2993:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(false, Node, ArgList),
 2994:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 2995:     ok.
 2996: 
 2997: spawn_huge_arglist_test(Local, Node, ArgList) ->
 2998: 
 2999:     R1 = case Local of
 3000:              true ->
 3001:                  spawn_request(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor]);
 3002:              false ->
 3003:                  spawn_request(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor])
 3004:          end,
 3005:     receive
 3006:         {spawn_reply, R1, ok, Pid1} ->
 3007:             Pid1 ! go,
 3008:             receive
 3009:                 {'DOWN', R1, process, Pid1, Reason1} ->
 3010:                     ArgList = Reason1
 3011:             end
 3012:     end,
 3013: 
 3014:     {Pid2, R2} = case Local of
 3015:                      true ->
 3016:                          spawn_monitor(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3017:                      false ->
 3018:                          spawn_monitor(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3019:                  end,
 3020:     Node = node(Pid2),
 3021:     Pid2 ! go,
 3022:     receive
 3023:         {'DOWN', R2, process, Pid2, Reason2} ->
 3024:             ArgList = Reason2
 3025:     end,
 3026:     
 3027:     {Pid3, R3} = case Local of
 3028:                      true ->
 3029:                          spawn_opt(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor]);
 3030:                      false ->
 3031:                          spawn_opt(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor])
 3032:                  end,
 3033:     Node = node(Pid3),
 3034:     Pid3 ! go,
 3035:     receive
 3036:         {'DOWN', R3, process, Pid3, Reason3} ->
 3037:             ArgList = Reason3
 3038:     end,
 3039: 
 3040:     OldTA = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3041:     Pid4 = case Local of
 3042:                true ->
 3043:                    spawn_link(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3044:                false ->
 3045:                    spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3046:            end,
 3047:     Node = node(Pid4),
 3048:     Pid4 ! go,
 3049:     receive
 3050:         {'EXIT', Pid4, Reason4} ->
 3051:             ArgList = Reason4
 3052:     end,
 3053: 
 3054:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, OldTA),
 3055: 
 3056:     Pid5 = case Local of
 3057:                true ->
 3058:                    spawn(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3059:                false ->
 3060:                    spawn(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3061:            end,
 3062:     Node = node(Pid5),
 3063:     R5 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid5),
 3064:     Pid5 ! go,
 3065:     receive
 3066:         {'DOWN', R5, process, Pid5, Reason5} ->
 3067:             ArgList = Reason5
 3068:     end,
 3069:     ok.
 3070: 
 3071: spawn_request_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3072:     io:format("Testing spawn_request() on local node...~n", []),
 3073:     spawn_request_bif_test(true, node()),
 3074:     io:format("Testing spawn_request() on local node with Node...~n", []),
 3075:     spawn_request_bif_test(false, node()),
 3076:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3077:     io:format("Testing spawn_request() on remote node ~p...~n", [Node]),
 3078:     spawn_request_bif_test(false, Node),
 3079:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3080:     ok.
 3081:                        
 3082: spawn_request_bif_test(Local, Node) ->
 3083: 
 3084:     Me = self(),
 3085: 
 3086:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3087: 
 3088:     T1 = {test, 1},
 3089:     F1 = fun () -> exit({exit, T1}) end,
 3090:     R1 = if Local ->
 3091:                  spawn_request(F1, [{reply_tag, T1}, monitor, link]);
 3092:             true ->
 3093:                  spawn_request(Node, F1, [{reply_tag, T1}, monitor, link])
 3094:          end,
 3095:     receive
 3096:         {T1, R1, ok, P1} ->
 3097:             receive
 3098:                 {'DOWN', R1, process, P1, {exit, T1}} ->
 3099:                     ok
 3100:             end,
 3101:             receive
 3102:                 {'EXIT', P1, {exit, T1}} ->
 3103:                     ok
 3104:             end
 3105:     end,
 3106: 
 3107:     R1b = if Local ->
 3108:                  spawn_request(F1, [monitor, link]);
 3109:             true ->
 3110:                  spawn_request(Node, F1, [monitor, link])
 3111:          end,
 3112:     receive
 3113:         {spawn_reply, R1b, ok, P1b} ->
 3114:             receive
 3115:                 {'DOWN', R1b, process, P1b, {exit, T1}} ->
 3116:                     ok
 3117:             end,
 3118:             receive
 3119:                 {'EXIT', P1b, {exit, T1}} ->
 3120:                     ok
 3121:             end
 3122:     end,
 3123: 
 3124:     Ref1c = make_ref(),
 3125:     F1c = fun () -> Me ! Ref1c end,
 3126:     R1c = if Local ->
 3127:                   spawn_request(F1c);
 3128:              true ->
 3129:                   spawn_request(Node, F1c)
 3130:             end,
 3131:     receive
 3132:         {spawn_reply, R1c, ok, _P1c} ->
 3133:             receive Ref1c -> ok end
 3134:     end,
 3135: 
 3136:     R1e = if Local ->
 3137:                  spawn_request(F1, [monitors, links, {reply_tag, T1}]);
 3138:             true ->
 3139:                  spawn_request(Node, F1, [monitors, links, {reply_tag, T1}])
 3140:          end,
 3141:     receive
 3142:         {T1, R1e, error, BadOpt1} ->
 3143:             badopt = BadOpt1,
 3144:             ok
 3145:     end,
 3146:     ok = try
 3147:              BadF = fun (X) -> exit({X,T1}) end,
 3148:              if Local ->
 3149:                      spawn_request(BadF, [monitor, {reply_tag, T1}, link]);
 3150:                 true ->
 3151:                      spawn_request(Node, BadF, [monitor, {reply_tag, T1}, link])
 3152:              end,
 3153:              nok
 3154:          catch
 3155:              error:badarg -> ok
 3156:          end,
 3157:     ok = try
 3158:              spawn_request(<<"node">>, F1, [monitor, link], T1),
 3159:              nok
 3160:          catch
 3161:              error:badarg -> ok
 3162:          end,
 3163: 
 3164:     T2 = {test, 2},
 3165:     M2 = erlang,
 3166:     F2 = exit,
 3167:     Reason2 = {exit, T2},
 3168:     Args2 = [Reason2],
 3169:     R2 = if Local ->
 3170:                  spawn_request(M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link, {reply_tag, T2}]);
 3171:             true ->
 3172:                  spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link, {reply_tag, T2}])
 3173:             end,
 3174:     receive
 3175:         {T2, R2, ok, P2} ->
 3176:             receive
 3177:                 {'DOWN', R2, process, P2, Reason2} ->
 3178:                     ok
 3179:             end,
 3180:             receive
 3181:                 {'EXIT', P2, Reason2} ->
 3182:                     ok
 3183:             end
 3184:     end,

 3187:                  spawn_request(M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link]);
 3188:             true ->
 3189:                  spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link])
 3190:             end,
 3191:     receive
 3192:         {spawn_reply, R2b, ok, P2b} ->
 3193:             receive
 3194:                 {'DOWN', R2b, process, P2b, Reason2} ->
 3195:                     ok
 3196:             end,
 3197:             receive
 3198:                 {'EXIT', P2b, Reason2} ->
 3199:                     ok
 3200:             end
 3201:     end,

 3205:                   spawn_request(erlang, send, [Me, Ref2c]);

 3208:             end,
 3209:     receive
 3210:         {spawn_reply, R2c, ok, _P2c} ->
